bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ①A group of pharmaceutical substances added to materia medica by Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 as huo bu 火部 , “fire section”. including 11 different fires, e.g., ai huo 艾火 , “ fire of the moxa herb”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 , huo bu 火部：火之用其至矣哉 , “The usefulness of fire is extreme”.

②Physiological term referring to those yang qi in the human organism that have a warming, nourishing, and stimulating function. Su wen 素問 5: 少火生氣 , “A small fire generates qi”. ③ Alternative Names huo bing 火病 , fire disease. Pathological Condition of exuberant yang qi manifesting itself as dryness, heat, shock, sores, redness and swelling. Su wen 素問 74: 諸躁狂越，皆屬於火 , “All [cases of] overexcitement and jumping in madness, without exception they are associated with fire ”. ④ Alternative Names huo qi 火氣 , fire qi; huo xie 火邪 , fire evil. Etiological Agent. able to bring forth fire disease, similar to heat-type diseases they flame upward. Su wen 素問 74: 火淫所勝，平以 酸冷 , “When fire [as the qi controlling heaven] encroaches upon what it dominates, this is balanced with sour [flavor] and cold”.

Pathological Condition of a ban 瘢 , scar, resulting from burns. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry gou 狗 quotes Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 : 眉 髪 火瘢不生者，蒲灰，以正月狗腦和敷，日三，則生 , “For a fire scar that does not let the eyebrows grow again: pu ashes are to be externally applied together with a dog’s brain taken in a year’s first month. After three days, they will grow”. Possibly this is a modified quote that in fact originates from Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 13: 治 眉毛鬢髮為火燒瘡瘢毛不生方：蒲灰以正月狗腦和敷，即生 , “Recipe for scars of sores resulting from burns with eyebrows and hair on the temples failing to grow again: pu ashes are to be externally applied together with a dog’s brain taken in a year’s first month”.
